writeGeneAsTsv

void writeGeneAsTsv(java.io.OutputStream out,
                    GeneInfo gene)
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes all the data on the given gene to out, as a tab-separated list of items.

Order: EntrezGene ID, taxon,offical symbold (short and long form where available), aliases and synonyms, chromosomal location, EntrezGene summary, GeneRIFs, PubMed IDs, protein mass, protein length, protein mutations, protein domains, subcellular location, tissue specificity, protein interaction partners, function, disease, GO codes, keywords.

Parameters:
out -
gene -
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
writeTsvItem(OutputStream, String)

writeTsvItem

void writeTsvItem(java.io.OutputStream out,
                  java.lang.String data)
            throws java.io.IOException
Writes a TSV item to out: first a tab and then the data
. If the data is empty or null, writes a dash '-'.

Parameters:
out -
data -
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeGeneAsXml

void writeGeneAsXml(java.io.OutputStream out,
                    GeneInfo gene)
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes all the data on the given gene to out, in an XML format.

Content: EntrezGene ID, taxon,offical symbold (short and long form where available), aliases and synonyms, chromosomal location, EntrezGene summary, GeneRIFs, PubMed IDs, protein mass, protein length, protein mutations, protein domains, subcellular location, tissue specificity, protein interaction partners, function, disease, GO codes, keywords.

Parameters:
out -
gene -
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
#writeXmlItem(OutputStream, String), writeGeneAsTsv(OutputStream, GeneInfo)

writeXmlItem

void writeXmlItem(java.io.OutputStream out,
                  java.lang.String element,
                  java.lang.String content)
            throws java.io.IOException
Writes an Xml item to out: an element with content. If the content is empty or null, skips the element. TODO no Xml validity check is currently done on content

getValues

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getValues(java.lang.String table,
                                                                                   java.lang.String column,
                                                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> geneIds)
Reads data from the given column and table, for all geneIds.

If a database connection could not be established / re-opened, tries three more times by invoking getValues(String, String, Set, int) recursively.

Parameters:
table -
column -
geneIds -
Returns:

getValues

private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getValues(java.lang.String table,
                                                                                   java.lang.String column,
                                                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> geneIds,
                                                                                   int tries)
Reads data from the given column and table, for all geneIds.

If a database connection could not be established, stops after the third try.

This method is invoked recursively and should not be called directly! It is called only by getValues(String, String, Set).

Parameters:
table -
column -
geneIds -
tries -
Returns:

toIdBuffer

Returns a comma-separated list of the given IDs in a string.
